channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2024030337
item.description:
Report X-2024030337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed leaking hazmat package and notified van line manager. DescribePack: Puncture at the bottom corner of plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Manager notified QA. QA placed damaged hazmat in a plastic lined hazmat tote while wearing latex gloves.

item.title: Report X-2024021646
item.description:
Report X-2024021646

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: RENO
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations. 1 pallet, shrink wrapped in black pallet. No markings or labels on the outside that indicated DG. The shrink was removed to reveal 36 brown fiberboard boxes of UN 3268 Safety Devices. 5.5 kg each. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation
